comment: Take this class! He is such a good teacher! super fun and entertaining! quiz due on monday, roll play rooms for selling, video submissions, essay, final exam. all not super difficult if you come to class. attendance mandatory. highly recommend- made me look into a sales career!
Possibly best professor at the school that I have taken. Also possibly one of the nicest, down to earth, kindhearted human beings I have ever met. Need I say more?

Top 5 professor at Kennesaw State. Sales class is excellent, lectures are top-tier. Management class was my favorite at Kennesaw. McCulloch is a fantastic teacher and he is a refreshing example of an academic with a mountain of professional experience in what he teaches. You have to attend class. You would be wise to take BMac.

Class is based around a role play. Role play is simple, just attend class and try to learn it. McCulloch is a very knowledgeable and thorough professor. He really cares for his students and will answer any questions. Lectures are better than most. Ask questions and he will always be there to help you and does his best to answer. Take his class.

He is incredibly witty. Wonderful man, very easy class but you must attend in order to pass as attendance is 15% of grade. His real life examples are worth taking his class alone, but his final class is one of the best and most inspirational I have ever attended. Material is a breeze, and there are no tests. Highly recommend him.

I'll be in the minority here saying that an easy class does not equal a good professor. Professor McCulloch seems like a great guy, but I didn't learn anything from this class that I didn't already hear in 1 unit of "intro to marketing". The man repeats himself so much, as if saying "we're not just like used car salesmen" enough will make it true.

Professor McCulloch is a fantastic professor! one of my favorite if not my favorite. His lectures are fun and entertaining. He has a great personality and is extremely fair and reasonable. We had no exams, just 10 quizzes (must be in class to pass), and then the final project which is a professional sales call role play. If you try you'll pass
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--Graded by few things

comment: Took him for intro to pro sales and now for sales management. He cares deeply about his students and takes pride in his lectures. You must go to class because attendance is 15% of your grade but besides that this class quiz / roleplay wise was much easier than the intro to prosales class. 10/10 take him you will not regret it. Worth the 8am wakeup
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational

comment: He is a great guy! If you are going into sales, take him. He genuinely means well, and has great intentions. Learned a lot and feel very confident going into sales later on. Class is mandatory. I had him for 8am and went everyday and low-key looked forward to it sometimes bc hes that engaging.

I'm a Finance major and I needed to take an outside elective. Not a ton of work just weekly quizzes, mandatory attendance (part of grade), final sales roleplay. If you just prepare for the roleplays, you'll be fine. Marketing majors have to take sales and if you can, take McCulloch. This guy is awesome. Very friendly and wants everyone to do well.
rating_tags: Inspirational--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: You really can't dislike the dude. The course requires a minimal amount of work, and the in-class experience is pretty positive overall. Attendance is required which is a bummer, but he is understanding of life and allows you to miss a class now and then if really needed.
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: Professor McCulloch is fantastic. His class primarily involves weekly quizzes and multiple roleplays that you do with an assigned partner. The roleplays were conducted online, so I'm not sure that would stay the same if COVID wasn't a thing. Regardless, I felt like I learned a lot from his class. Highly recommend McCulloch's class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: By far the best professor at KSU hands down. He really gets to know his students and will help anyone out in a heartbeat. You really learn the most with him because he gives real life examples as he teaches. TAKE HIM!

I love this professor. You can tell he really cares about sales and especially his students. This man can make anyone into a salesperson. Great jokes thought all of his lectures and such a shining personality. Easily one of the best professors I've ever had. Pretty easy A if you do your work which is not a lot.
The final role play was graded extremely harsh and unfair.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Professor McCulloch is easily one of my 3 favorite professors at KSU. He really wants you to succeed and learn how to sell because he knows it is important for a business. He is so funny and easy to talk to. Easy tests, take him if you can!

Probably one of the best teachers Ive ever taken! He cared about his students and you can tell that from Day 1! You do have to put in the work for sales presentation but nothing too hard. Definitely recommend.

Professor McCulloch is not just a professor, but also a mentor to his students. His experience within the sales field is unparalleled by any professor. He is truly one of a kind within the world of college professors, and I will forever remember this class. Also, if you happen to read this BMac, Go Dawgs!

Professor McCulloch takes time to meet with every student in order to get to know them which is more than any of my other professors have ever done. There is mandatory attendance but his lectures are very interesting so it's worth it! I am not a sales major but I still learned important skills that I will use later in life.
Amazing professor that wants you to succeed and does what he can in any way to help out.

This professor is a GEM! if you are taking Sales Management, this man will not fail you. He is the real deal and is worth all the credit. He is not a hard grader, but observes those who are putting in effort and are actually trying. Participate in the course and ill guarantee you will pass and his exams are easy !

Amazing professor! Literally the best professor at KSU, not sure why he doesn't have more ratings! He truly has a passion for selling and teaching it, and I highly consider you take him. I have never enjoyed an 8am class, but I loved this course and he made the class so interesting that if I get the opp. to take him for future courses I will!

Dont even think about taking another professor. This is your guy. His passion for teaching along with his unparalleled character will leave you eternally grateful. His content is applicable and his assignments are relevant. Truly an amazing professor.
Best teacher at Kennesaw! he is willing to work with his students and loves to get to know them. You will feel like you have learned a lot after each class. Take him if you can, he is AMAZING!

McCulloch has plenty of experience, which makes him a great teacher. He is very caring of his students that really try in his class, so be sure to be alert. He wants to see his students succeed and goes the extra mile for you if you ask.
